Desires
Desires

• Measure statewide prevalence of fruit and vegetable consumption, physical activity, Food Insecurity and Food Stamp use in the 130% and 185% Federal poverty Level (FPL) adult population
• Measure statewide prevalence of fruit and
vegetable consumption, physical activity,
Food Insecurity and Food Stamp use in the
130% and 185% Federal poverty Level (FPL)
adult population

• Questions not asked • Questions periodically and systematically

missing

Food Insecurity Questions
Food Insecurity Questions

The food that I bought just didn’t last, and I didn’t have money to get more. Was that OFTEN, SOMETIMES, or NEVER true for you in the last 12 months?
The food that I bought just didn’t last, and I didn’t have money to
get more. Was that OFTEN, SOMETIMES, or NEVER true for you
in the last 12 months?

I couldn’t afford to eat balanced meals. Was that OFTEN, SOMETIMES, or NEVER true for you in the last 12 months?
I couldn’t afford to eat balanced meals. Was that OFTEN,
SOMETIMES, or NEVER true for you in the last 12 months?

In the last 12 months, did you ever cut the size of your meals or skip meals because there wasn’t enough money for food?
In the last 12 months, did you ever cut the size of your meals or
skip meals because there wasn’t enough money for food?

• How often did this happen--almost every month, some months

but not every month, or in only one or two months?

In the last 12 months, did you ever eat less than you felt you should because there wasn’t enough money to buy food?
In the last 12 months, did you ever eat less than you felt you
should because there wasn’t enough money to buy food?

In the last 12 months, were you ever hungry but didn’t eat because you couldn’t afford enough food?

Food Security Scale
Food Security Scale

• 3 levels • 0-1 = Food Secure • 2-4 = Low Food Security • 5-6 = Very Low Food Security
• 3 levels
• 0-1 = Food Secure
• 2-4 = Low Food Security
• 5-6 = Very Low Food Security

Staying ahead
Staying ahead

• Buying questions for inclusion and continuity • Aggregating multiple years of data • Constructing indicators from existing variables • Institutionalizing 130% and 185% Federal
• Buying questions for inclusion and continuity
• Aggregating multiple years of data
• Constructing indicators from existing variables
• Institutionalizing 130% and 185% Federal

Poverty Level Indicators
Poverty Level Indicators

• Making available questions on food security • Promoting the national use of 130% and 185% Federal Poverty Level indicators to specifically target USDA funded low-income populations.
• Making available questions on food security
